channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: More deaths and lower wages in north of England, report reveals
item.description: The pandemic exacerbated inequalities in northern England in health and wealth, a study shows.

item.title: Sophie Moss death: MP says strangling sentence too lenient
item.description: Campaigners say the sentence given to Sophie Moss's killer sends a "dreadful message".

item.title: Clifton man sent women rape and acid attack threats
item.description: Shaquille Williams "inflicted extreme terror" on six women, the National Crime Agency says.

item.title: Animal rescue centre told planning bid 'proper whack'
item.description: A council says the response to sanctuary boss Amey James' application shouldn't have been published.

item.title: Thunderstorms cause flash-flooding in Devon
item.description: Businesses are affected and roads made impassable due to flood water caused by downpours.

item.title: Geronimo the alpaca: TB test results disputed
item.description: The government said it found evidence the animal had the disease, but supporters dispute this.

item.title: HGV driver shortage: Stafford farmer told to dump milk
item.description: A dairy farmer says the shortage of lorry drivers has hit milk collection and is a "constant worry".

item.title: Lewis Williams shooting: Girl recalls being threatened
item.description: The teenager tells a court she was threatened by one of those accused of fatally shooting Lewis Williams.

item.title: Disruption warning over 'significant' Kidderminster industrial fire
item.description: A school warns parents of potential issues at collection time, describing traffic as "gridlocked".

item.title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Fire service reluctant to take risks, expert says
item.description: The fire service was reluctant to take risks after the Manchester Arena bombing, an expert says.

item.title: England fan admits abusing players after Euro 2020 loss
item.description: Scott McCluskey posted racist comments about black England players on social media.

item.title: Migrants continue to cross Channel ahead of Priti Patel talks
item.description: Lifeboats from Hastings and Eastbourne have been deployed to "incidents" off the Sussex coast.

item.title: 9/11: 'All we could see was smoke in the distance'
item.description: A couple reflect on how close they came to being caught up in the devastation of the 9/11 attacks.

item.title: Silsden firefighters help lonely people with community garden
item.description: Crews who built a community garden to bring people together say they want to help their local area.

item.title: Motor neurone disease: Fundraising friends raise thousands for charity
item.description: Phil Rossall and Marcus Green raise money for charity through running and blinking challenges.

item.title: Footage shows 'significant' Kidderminster industrial fire
item.description: Footage shared on social media captures the scale of an industrial fire in Kidderminster.

item.title: Dartmoor tor conquered with rescue team's help
item.description: Gilby Taylor has longed wanted to visit the summit of a Dartmoor tor near his home.

item.title: Paddleboarders rescued by RNLI on first ride in water
item.description: The pair were rescued by coastguards and the RNLI in Somerset just hours after buying their boards.

item.title: AFC Fylde: Football club criticised for 'discriminatory' job advert
item.description: AFC Fylde tells people not to apply for a job if they need to pick up their children from school.

item.title: Murder victim died from stab wounds to chest
item.description: Police believe Maddie Durdant-Hollamby was fatally stabbed by her partner, who then killed himself.

item.title: Badger cull: New control areas despite cull phase-out
item.description: Seven new control sites are approved as ministers confirm regular culling will gradually cease.

item.title: Whitehaven coal mine: Plans attacked at inquiry
item.description: One resident says it will "pollute the environment" and harm this "beautiful place".

item.title: Bristol fairgrounds banned from giving goldfish as prizes
item.description: Bristol City Council says the tradition "should have no place in modern society".

item.title: Richard Dunn: Boxer's family seek footage of 1976 European title fight
item.description: Richard Dunn's family appeals for film of the fight that led him to face Muhammad Ali 45 years ago.

item.title: Poland v England: Gareth Southgate warns against complacency with 100% record on the line
item.description: England boss Gareth Southgate wants to maintain their 100% record in World Cup qualifying against Poland on Wednesday.

item.title: Eight to miss Premier League games as Brazil invoke ban
item.description: Eight Premier League players will be stopped from playing for their clubs this weekend after Brazilian football authorities trigger a Fifa rule to prevent them appearing.

item.title: Azeem Rafiq: Yorkshire urged to publish findings of racism inquiry 'immediately' by MPs
item.description: MPs urge Yorkshire to publish the findings of an independent report into allegations of racism "immediately".
